016import java.lang.invoke.LambdaMetafactory;
017import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle;
018import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
019import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
020import java.lang.invoke.MethodType;
021import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;
022
023import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
024import java.lang.reflect.Method;
025
026import java.util.ArrayList;
027import java.util.Collection;
028import java.util.Collections;
029import java.util.HashSet;
030import java.util.IdentityHashMap;
031import java.util.List;
032import java.util.Map;
033
034import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
035import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
036import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
037
038import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference;
039
040import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
041import java.util.function.BiFunction;
042import java.util.function.Consumer;
043import java.util.function.Function;
044import java.util.function.Supplier;

046import jakarta.interceptor.InvocationContext;

048import org.microbean.invoke.CachingSupplier;
049import org.microbean.invoke.FixedValueSupplier;

051/**
052 * A {@link Callable} {@link InvocationContext}.
053 *
054 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
055 */
056public final class Chain implements Callable<Object>, Cloneable, InvocationContext {
057
058  private static final Class<?>[] EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY = new Class<?>[0];
059
060  private static final Class<?>[] SINGLE_OBJECT_CLASS_ARRAY = new Class<?>[] { Object.class };
061
062  private static final Class<?>[] DOUBLE_OBJECT_CLASS_ARRAY = new Class<?>[] { Object.class, Object.class };
063
064  private static final Class<?>[] OBJECT_INVOCATIONCONTEXT_CLASS_ARRAY = new Class<?>[] { Object.class, InvocationContext.class };
065
066  private static final MethodType BICONSUMER_ACCEPT_SIGNATURE = MethodType.methodType(void.class, DOUBLE_OBJECT_CLASS_ARRAY);
067
068  private static final MethodType BICONSUMER_FACTORY_TYPE = MethodType.methodType(BiConsumer.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
069
070  private static final MethodType BIFUNCTION_APPLY_SIGNATURE = MethodType.methodType(Object.class, DOUBLE_OBJECT_CLASS_ARRAY);
071
072  private static final MethodType BIFUNCTION_FACTORY_TYPE = MethodType.methodType(BiFunction.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
073
074  private static final MethodType CONSUMER_ACCEPT_SIGNATURE = MethodType.methodType(void.class, SINGLE_OBJECT_CLASS_ARRAY);
075
076  private static final MethodType CONSUMER_FACTORY_TYPE = MethodType.methodType(Consumer.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
077
078  private static final Object[] EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY = new Object[0];
079
080  private static final MethodType FUNCTION_APPLY_SIGNATURE = MethodType.methodType(Object.class, SINGLE_OBJECT_CLASS_ARRAY);
081
082  private static final MethodType FUNCTION_FACTORY_TYPE = MethodType.methodType(Function.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
083
084  private static final MethodType INTERCEPTORFUNCTION_FACTORY_TYPE =
085    MethodType.methodType(InterceptorFunction.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
086
087  private static final MethodType INTERCEPTORFUNCTION_INTERCEPT_SIGNATURE =
088    MethodType.methodType(Object.class, OBJECT_INVOCATIONCONTEXT_CLASS_ARRAY);
089
090  private static final MethodType INTERCEPTORFUNCTION_METHOD_TYPE =
091    MethodType.methodType(Object.class, new Class<?>[] { InvocationContext.class });
092
093  private static final MethodType INTERCEPTORPROCEDURE_FACTORY_TYPE =
094    MethodType.methodType(InterceptorProcedure.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
095
096  private static final MethodType INTERCEPTORPROCEDURE_EXECUTE_SIGNATURE =
097    MethodType.methodType(void.class, OBJECT_INVOCATIONCONTEXT_CLASS_ARRAY);
098
099  private static final MethodType SUPPLIER_GET_SIGNATURE = MethodType.methodType(Object.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
100
101  private static final MethodType SUPPLIER_FACTORY_TYPE = MethodType.methodType(Supplier.class, EMPTY_CLASS_ARRAY);
102
103  private static final VarHandle CONTEXT_DATA;
104
105  private static final VarHandle PRIMED;
106
107  static {
108    final Lookup lookup = MethodHandles.lookup();
109    try {
110      CONTEXT_DATA = lookup.findVarHandle(Chain.class, "contextData", ConcurrentMap.class);
111      PRIMED = lookup.findVarHandle(Chain.class, "primed", boolean.class);
112    } catch (final NoSuchFieldException | IllegalAccessException e) {
113      throw (Error)new ExceptionInInitializerError(e.getMessage()).initCause(e);
114    }
115  }
116
117
118  /*
119   * Instance fields.
120   */
121
122
123  private final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions;
124
125  private final Map<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers;
126
127  private final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction;
128
129  // Note to future maintainers: you're going to want to come in here and do something fancy with VarHandle and normally
130  // that would absolutely be the right thing to do, but this field is passed by reference to copies of this Chain, so
131  // don't get clever and please leave this alone.
132  private final AtomicReference<Object> target;
133
134  private final CachingSupplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier;
135
136  private final CachingSupplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier;
137
138  private final CachingSupplier<?> timerSupplier;
139
140  private final boolean setTarget;
141
142  private volatile ConcurrentMap<String, Object> contextData;
143
144  private volatile Supplier<? extends Object[]> parameters;
145
146  private volatile boolean primed;
147
148
149  /*
150   * Constructors.
151   */
152
153
154  /**
155   * Creates a new {@link Chain}.
156   */
157  public Chain() {
158    this(List.of(),
159         false, // sort
160         false, // copy
161         null, // interceptorSuppliers
162         null, // contextData
163         new AtomicReference<>(), // target
164         null, // parameters
165         null, // constructorSupplier,
166         null, // methodSupplier,
167         null, // timerSupplier
168         null, // terminalFunction
169         false, // setTarget
170         false); // primed
171  }
172
173  private Chain(final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions,
174                final boolean sort,
175                final boolean copy,
176                final IdentityHashMap<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers, // read-only, but not copied!
177                final ConcurrentMap<String, Object> contextData,
178                final AtomicReference<Object> target,
179                final Supplier<? extends Object[]> parameters,
180                final Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier,
181                final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier,
182                final Supplier<?> timerSupplier,
183                final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
184                final boolean setTarget,
185                final boolean primed) {
186    super();
187    if (interceptorFunctions == null || interceptorFunctions.isEmpty()) {
188      this.interceptorFunctions = List.of();
189    } else if (sort) {
190      // copy is implied
191      final List<InterceptorFunction> unsortedInterceptorFunctions = new ArrayList<>(interceptorFunctions.size());
192      unsortedInterceptorFunctions.addAll(interceptorFunctions);
193      Collections.sort(unsortedInterceptorFunctions, Prioritized.Comparator.INSTANCE);
194      this.interceptorFunctions = Collections.unmodifiableList(unsortedInterceptorFunctions);
195    } else if (copy) {
196      this.interceptorFunctions = List.copyOf(interceptorFunctions);
197    } else {
198      this.interceptorFunctions = interceptorFunctions;
199    }
200    // Note to future maintainers: don't add isEmpty() check
201    this.interceptorSuppliers = interceptorSuppliers == null ? Map.of() : interceptorSuppliers;
202    this.contextData = contextData;
203    this.target = target == null ? new AtomicReference<>() : target;
204    this.parameters = parameters;
205    if (constructorSupplier == null) {
206      this.constructorSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(Chain::returnNull);
207    } else if (constructorSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<? extends Constructor<?>> cachingSupplier) {
208      this.constructorSupplier = cachingSupplier;
209    } else {
210      this.constructorSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(constructorSupplier);
211    }
212    if (methodSupplier == null) {
213      this.methodSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(Chain::returnNull);
214    } else if (methodSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<? extends Method> cachingSupplier) {
215      this.methodSupplier = cachingSupplier;
216    } else {
217      this.methodSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(methodSupplier);
218    }
219    if (timerSupplier == null) {
220      this.timerSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(Chain::returnNull);
221    } else if (timerSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<?> cachingSupplier) {
222      this.timerSupplier = cachingSupplier;
223    } else {
224      this.timerSupplier = new CachingSupplier<>(timerSupplier);
225    }
226    if (terminalFunction == null) {
227      this.terminalFunction = NullTerminalFunction.INSTANCE;
228    } else {
229      this.terminalFunction = terminalFunction;
230    }
231    this.setTarget = setTarget;
232    this.primed = primed || this.interceptorSuppliers.isEmpty();
233  }
234
235
236  /*
237   * Instance methods.
238   */
239
240
241  /*
242   * Builder-like methods.
243   */
244
245
246  /**
247   * Returns a {@link Chain} whose internal list of {@link InterceptorFunction}s is sorted by {@linkplain
248   * Prioritized#priority() priority}, where the smallest number "wins".
249   *
250   * @return a {@link Chain}
251   *
252   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
253   *
254   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily deterministic, since two {@link InterceptorFunction}s
255   * with the same {@linkplain Prioritized#priority() priority} may sort to different indices in the relevant list.
256   *
257   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
258   */
259  public final Chain sort() {
260    return this.interceptorFunctions.size() <= 1 ? this : this.copy(this.interceptorFunctions, true);
261  }
262
263  /**
264   * Returns this {@link Chain} with its {@linkplain #getTarget() target} already set to the supplied {@code target}.
265   *
266   * @param target the new target; may be {@code null}
267   *
268   * @return this {@link Chain}
269   *
270   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
271   *
272   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
273   *
274   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
275   *
276   * @see #getTarget()
277   */
278  public final Chain withTarget(final Object target) {
279    this.target.set(target);
280    return this;
281  }
282
283  /**
284   * Calls {@link #setParameters(Object[])} with the supplied {@code parameters} and returns this {@link Chain}.
285   *
286   * @param parameters the parameters; may be {@code null}
287   *
288   * @return this {@link Chain}
289   *
290   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
291   *
292   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
293   *
294   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
295   *
296   * @see #setParameters(Object[])
297   */
298  public final Chain withParameters(final Object... parameters) {
299    this.setParameters(parameters);
300    return this;
301  }
302
303  /**
304   * Calls {@link #setParameters(Supplier)} with the supplied {@code parametersSupplier} and returns this {@link Chain}.
305   *
306   * @param parametersSupplier a {@link Supplier} supplying parameters; may be {@code null}
307   *
308   * @return this {@link Chain}
309   *
310   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
311   *
312   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
313   *
314   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
315   *
316   * @see #setParameters(Supplier)
317   */
318  public final Chain withParameters(final Supplier<? extends Object[]> parametersSupplier) {
319    this.setParameters(parametersSupplier);
320    return this;
321  }
322
323  /**
324   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of an {@link InterceptorFunction} built from the supplied
325   * arguments.
326   *
327   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
328   *
329   * @param method a {@link Method} representing an interceptor method; must not be {@code null}
330   *
331   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
332   *
333   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code lookup} or {@code method} is {@code null}
334   *
335   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
336   *
337   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
338   *
339   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
340   *
341   * @see #plusInterceptorFunction(Lookup, Method, Supplier)
342   */
343  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final Method method) {
344    // Note to future maintainers: Don't get clever and pass this::getTarget instead of null as the trailing parameter.
345    return this.plusInterceptorFunction(lookup, method, null);
346  }
347
348  /**
349   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of an {@link InterceptorFunction} built from the supplied
350   * arguments.
351   *
352   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
353   *
354   * @param method a {@link Method} representing an interceptor method; must not be {@code null}
355   *
356   * @param interceptorSupplier a {@link Supplier} of an interceptor on which the supplied {@code method} will
357   * effectively be invoked; may be {@code null}
358   *
359   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
360   *
361   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code lookup} or {@code method} is {@code null}
362   *
363   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
364   *
365   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
366   *
367   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
368   *
369   * @see #interceptorFunction(Lookup, Method)
370   *
371   * @see #plusInterceptorFunction(InterceptorFunction, Supplier)
372   */
373  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final Method method, final Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier) {
374    return this.plusInterceptorFunction(interceptorFunction(lookup, method), interceptorSupplier);
375  }
376
377  /**
378   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}.
379   *
380   * @param function the {@link InterceptorFunction}; may be {@code null} in which case this {@link Chain} will be
381   * returned
382   *
383   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
384   *
385   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
386   *
387   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
388   *
389   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
390   */
391  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final InterceptorFunction function) {
392    // Note to future maintainers: Don't get clever and pass this::getTarget instead of null as the trailing parameter.
393    return this.plusInterceptorFunction(function, null);
394  }
395
396  /**
397   * Returns a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}.
398   *
399   * @param function the {@link InterceptorFunction}; may be {@code null} in which case this {@link Chain} will be
400   * returned
401   *
402   * @param interceptorSupplier a {@link Supplier} of an interceptor; may be {@code null} in which case an appropriate
403   * representation of the {@link #getTarget()} method will be used instead
404   *
405   * @return a {@link Chain} that reflects the addition of the supplied {@link InterceptorFunction}
406   *
407   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
408   *
409   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
410   *
411   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
412   */
413  public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(final InterceptorFunction function, final Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier) {
414    if (function == null) {
415      return this;
416    }
417    final List<InterceptorFunction> unsortedInterceptorFunctions = new ArrayList<>(this.interceptorFunctions.size() + 1);
418    unsortedInterceptorFunctions.addAll(this.interceptorFunctions);
419    unsortedInterceptorFunctions.add(function);
420    final IdentityHashMap<InterceptorFunction, Supplier<?>> map = new IdentityHashMap<>(this.interceptorSuppliers);
421    final Supplier<?> thisGetTarget = this::getTarget;
422    if (interceptorSupplier == null || interceptorSupplier == thisGetTarget) {
423      map.put(function, thisGetTarget);
424    } else if (interceptorSupplier instanceof CachingSupplier<?> cs) {
425      map.put(function, cs);
426    } else {
427      map.put(function, new CachingSupplier<>(interceptorSupplier));
428    }
429    return this.copy(unsortedInterceptorFunctions, false, map);
430  }
431
432  /**
433   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
434   * {@link Constructor}.
435   *
436   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
437   *
438   * @param constructor a {@link Constructor}; must not be {@code null}
439   *
440   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
441   *
442   * @return a {@link Chain}
443   *
444   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
445   *
446   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
447   *
448   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
449   *
450   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
451   *
452   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
453   *
454   * @see Lookup#unreflectConstructor(Constructor)
455   */
456  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup, final Constructor<?> constructor) {
457    constructor.trySetAccessible();
458    try {
459      final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor = terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.unreflectConstructor(constructor));
460      return
461        this.withTerminalFunction((x, p) -> terminalConstructor.apply(p),
462                                  true,
463                                  () -> constructor,
464                                  null,
465                                  null);
466    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
467      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
468    }
469  }
470
471  /**
472   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
473   * {@link Method}.
474   *
475   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
476   *
477   * @param factoryMethod a {@link Method}; must not be {@code null}
478   *
479   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
480   *
481   * @return a {@link Chain}
482   *
483   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
484   *
485   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
486   *
487   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
488   *
489   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
490   *
491   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
492   *
493   * @see Lookup#unreflect(Method)
494   */
495  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup, final Method factoryMethod) {
496    factoryMethod.trySetAccessible();
497    try {
498      final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor = terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.unreflect(factoryMethod));
499      return
500        this.withTerminalFunction((x, p) -> terminalConstructor.apply(p),
501                                  true,
502                                  null,
503                                  () -> factoryMethod,
504                                  null);
505    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
506      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
507    }
508  }
509
510  /**
511   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
512   * {@link MethodHandle}.
513   *
514   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
515   *
516   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code null}
517   *
518   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
519   *
520   * @return a {@link Chain}
521   *
522   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
523   *
524   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
525   *
526   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
527   *
528   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
529   *
530   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
531   */
532  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup, final MethodHandle mh) {
533    try {
534      return
535        this.withTerminalConstructor(terminalConstructor(lookup, mh),
536                                     () -> MethodHandles.reflectAs(Constructor.class, mh));
537    } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
538      throw e;
539    } catch (final Exception e) {
540      if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
541        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
542      }
543      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
544    } catch (final Throwable e) {
545      throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
546    }
547  }
548
549  /**
550   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
551   * constructing {@link Function}.
552   *
553   * @param constructor a constructing {@link Function}; must not be {@code null}
554   *
555   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code constructor} is {@code null}
556   *
557   * @return a {@link Chain}
558   *
559   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
560   *
561   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
562   *
563   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
564   *
565   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
566   */
567  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Function<? super Object[], ?> constructor) {
568    return this.withTerminalConstructor(constructor, null);
569  }
570
571  /**
572   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
573   * constructing {@link Function}.
574   *
575   * @param constructor a constructing {@link Function}; must not be {@code null}
576   *
577   * @param constructorSupplier a {@link Supplier} that will {@linkplain Supplier#get() supply} a {@link Constructor}
578   * when the {@link #getConstructor()} method is invoked; may be {@code null}
579   *
580   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code constructor} is {@code null}
581   *
582   * @return a {@link Chain}
583   *
584   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
585   *
586   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
587   *
588   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
589   *
590   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
591   */
592  public final Chain withTerminalConstructor(final Function<? super Object[], ?> constructor,
593                                             final Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier) {
594    return
595      this.withTerminalFunction((x, p) -> constructor.apply(p),
596                                true,
597                                constructorSupplier,
598                                null,
599                                null);
600  }
601
602  /**
603   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
604   * {@link Method}.
605   *
606   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
607   *
608   * @param method the terminal {@link Method}; must not be {@code null}
609   *
610   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
611   *
612   * @return a {@link Chain}
613   *
614   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
615   *
616   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
617   *
618   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
619   *
620   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
621   */
622  public final Chain withTerminalMethod(final Lookup lookup, final Method method) {
623    method.trySetAccessible();
624    try {
625      return
626        this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction(lookup, lookup.unreflect(method)),
627                                  false,
628                                  null,
629                                  () -> method,
630                                  null);
631    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
632      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
633    }
634  }
635
636  /**
637   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
638   * {@link MethodHandle}.
639   *
640   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
641   *
642   * @param mh the terminal {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code null}
643   *
644   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
645   *
646   * @return a {@link Chain}
647   *
648   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
649   *
650   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
651   *
652   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
653   *
654   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
655   */
656  public final Chain withTerminalMethod(final Lookup lookup, final MethodHandle mh) {
657    try {
658      return
659        this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction(lookup, mh),
660                                  false,
661                                  null,
662                                  () -> MethodHandles.reflectAs(Method.class, mh),
663                                  null);
664    } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
665      throw e;
666    } catch (final Exception e) {
667      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
668    } catch (final Throwable e) {
669      throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
670    }
671  }
672
673  /**
674   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
675   * {@code terminalConsumer}.
676   *
677   * @param terminalConsumer the terminal {@link Consumer}; must not be {@code null}
678   *
679   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalConsumer} is {@code null}
680   *
681   * @return a {@link Chain}
682   *
683   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
684   *
685   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
686   *
687   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
688   *
689   * @see #withTerminalConsumer(Consumer, Supplier)
690   */
691  public final Chain withTerminalConsumer(final Consumer<? super Object> terminalConsumer) {
692    return this.withTerminalConsumer(terminalConsumer, null);
693  }
694
695  /**
696   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
697   * {@code terminalConsumer}.
698   *
699   * @param terminalConsumer the terminal {@link Consumer}; must not be {@code null}
700   *
701   * @param methodSupplier a {@link Supplier} that will {@linkplain Supplier#get() supply} a {@link Method} when the
702   * {@link #getMethod()} method is invoked; may be {@code null}
703   *
704   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalConsumer} is {@code null}
705   *
706   * @return a {@link Chain}
707   *
708   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
709   *
710   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
711   *
712   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
713   *
714   * @see #getMethod()
715   */
716  public final Chain withTerminalConsumer(final Consumer<? super Object> terminalConsumer,
717                                          final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier) {
718    return
719      this.withTerminalFunction((t, x) -> {
720          terminalConsumer.accept(t);
721          return null;
722        },
723        false,
724        null,
725        methodSupplier,
726        this::getTimer);
727  }
728
729  /**
730   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
731   * {@code terminalFunction}.
732   *
733   * @param selfContainedTerminalFunction the terminal function; must not be {@code null}
734   *
735   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code selfContainedTerminalFunction} is {@code null}
736   *
737   * @return a {@link Chain}
738   *
739   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
740   *
741   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
742   *
743   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
744   *
745   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
746   */
747  private final Chain withTerminalFunction(final Function<? super Object[], ?> selfContainedTerminalFunction) {
748    return this.withTerminalFunction((x, p) -> selfContainedTerminalFunction.apply(p), null);
749  }
750
751  /**
752   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
753   * {@code terminalFunction}.
754   *
755   * @param terminalFunction the terminal function; must not be {@code null}
756   *
757   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalFunction} is {@code null}
758   *
759   * @return a {@link Chain}
760   *
761   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
762   *
763   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
764   *
765   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
766   *
767   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
768   */
769  public final Chain withTerminalFunction(final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction) {
770    return this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction, null);
771  }
772
773  /**
774   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() terminated} with the supplied
775   * {@code terminalFunction}.
776   *
777   * @param terminalFunction the terminal function; must not be {@code null}
778   *
779   * @param methodSupplier a {@link Supplier} that will {@linkplain Supplier#get() supply} a {@link Method} when the
780   * {@link #getMethod()} method is invoked; may be {@code null}
781   *
782   * @return a {@link Chain}
783   *
784   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code terminalFunction} is {@code null}
785   *
786   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
787   *
788   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
789   *
790   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
791   *
792   * @see #getMethod()
793   */
794  public final Chain withTerminalFunction(final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
795                                          final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier) {
796    return
797      this.withTerminalFunction(terminalFunction,
798                                false,
799                                null,
800                                methodSupplier,
801                                this::getTimer);
802  }
803
804  private final Chain withTerminalFunction(final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
805                                           final boolean setTarget,
806                                           Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier,
807                                           Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier,
808                                           Supplier<?> timerSupplier) {
809    if (constructorSupplier == null) {
810      if (methodSupplier == null) {
811        constructorSupplier = this::getConstructor;
812        methodSupplier = this::getMethod;
813      }
814    } else if (methodSupplier != null || timerSupplier != null) {
815      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have both a constructor supplier and either a method supplier or a timer supplier");
816    }
817    return
818      this.copy(0,
819                constructorSupplier,
820                methodSupplier,
821                timerSupplier == null ? this::getTimer : timerSupplier,
822                terminalFunction,
823                setTarget);
824  }
825
826  /**
827   * Returns <strong>a copy of</strong> this {@link Chain} with the supplied {@code timerSupplier} backing its {@link
828   * #getTimer()} method.
829   *
830   * @param timerSupplier a {@link Supplier} whose {@link Supplier#get() get()} method will implement the {@link
831   * #getTimer()} method; may be {@code null}
832   *
833   * @return a {@link Chain}
834   *
835   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
836   *
837   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
838   *
839   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
840   */
841  public final Chain withTimerSupplier(final Supplier<?> timerSupplier) {
842    return
843      this.copy(0,
844                this::getConstructor,
845                this::getMethod,
846                timerSupplier == null ? this::getTimer : timerSupplier,
847                this.terminalFunction,
848                this.setTarget);
849  }

851
852
853  /*
854   * Non-"builder" instance methods.
855   */
856
857
858  /**
859   * Returns the size of this {@link Chain}.
860   *
861   * <p>A {@link Chain}'s size consists of the sum of the number of its interceptor functions, plus {@code 1} if it
862   * {@linkplain #isTerminated() is terminated}.</p>
863   *
864   * @return ths size of this {@link Chain}; never negative
865   *
866   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
867   *
868   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
869   *
870   * @see #isTerminated()
871   */
872  public final int size() {
873    return this.interceptorFunctions.size() + (this.isTerminated() ? 1 : 0);
874  }
875
876  /**
877   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() is not terminated} and {@linkplain
878   * #intercepts() does not intercept}.
879   *
880   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} {@linkplain #isTerminated() is not terminated} and {@linkplain
881   * #intercepts() does not intercept}
882   *
883   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
884   *
885   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
886   *
887   * @see #isTerminated()
888   *
889   * @see #intercepts()
890   */
891  public final boolean isEmpty() {
892    return !this.isTerminated() && !this.intercepts();
893  }
894
895  /**
896   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is terminated with a {@linkplain #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction,
897   * Supplier) terminal function}.
898   *
899   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is terminated with a {@linkplain #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction,
900   * Supplier) terminal function}
901   *
902   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
903   *
904   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
905   *
906   * @see #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)
907   */
908  public final boolean isTerminated() {
909    return this.terminalFunction != NullTerminalFunction.INSTANCE;
910  }
911
912  /**
913   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} has at least one {@link InterceptorFunction} and hence will actually
914   * perform an interception.
915   *
916   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} will perform an interception; {@code false} otherwise
917   *
918   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
919   *
920   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
921   */
922  public final boolean intercepts() {
923    return !this.interceptorFunctions.isEmpty();
924  }
925
926  /**
927   * If a {@link Constructor} is available, returns it, or {@code null}.
928   *
929   * @return a {@link Constructor}, or {@code null}
930   *
931   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
932   *
933   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
934   *
935   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
936   */
937  @Override // InvocationContext
938  public final Constructor<?> getConstructor() {
939    return this.constructorSupplier.get();
940  }
941
942  /**
943   * If a {@link Method} is available, returns it, or {@code null}.
944   *
945   * @return a {@link Method}, or {@code null}
946   *
947   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
948   *
949   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
950   *
951   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
952   */
953  @Override // InvocationContext
954  public final Method getMethod() {
955    return this.methodSupplier.get();
956  }
957
958  /**
959   * If a timer is available, returns it, or {@code null}.
960   *
961   * <p>A timer is rarely available.</p>
962   *
963   * @return a timer, or {@code null}
964   *
965   * @nullability This method often returns {@code null}.
966   *
967   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
968   *
969   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
970   */
971  @Override // InvocationContext
972  public final Object getTimer() {
973    return this.timerSupplier.get();
974  }
975
976  /**
977   * Returns a mutable, thread-safe {@link ConcurrentMap} of context data for the current invocation or interception
978   * event.
979   *
980   * @return a mutable, thread-safe {@link ConcurrentMap} of context data for the current invocation or interception
981   * event
982   *
983   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
984   *
985   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily deterministic.
986   *
987   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
988   *
989   * @see InvocationContext#getContextData()
990   */
991  @Override // InvocationContext
992  public final ConcurrentMap<String, Object> getContextData() {
993    ConcurrentMap<String, Object> map = this.contextData; // volatile read
994    if (map == null) {
995      map = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
996      if (!CONTEXT_DATA.compareAndSet(this, null, map)) { // volatile write
997        return this.contextData; // volatile read
998      }
999    }
1000    return map;
1001  }
1002
1003  /**
1004   * Returns <strong>a copy</strong> of the parameters for this {@link Chain}.
1005   *
1006   * @return a copy of the parameters for this {@link Chain}
1007   *
1008   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1009   *
1010   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily deterministic.
1011   *
1012   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1013   *
1014   * @see #setParameters(Object[])
1015   *
1016   * @see InvocationContext#getParameters()
1017   */
1018  @Override // InvocationContext
1019  public final Object[] getParameters() {
1020    final Supplier<? extends Object[]> supplier = this.parameters; // volatile read
1021    if (supplier == null) {
1022      return EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY;
1023    } else {
1024      final Object[] returnValue = supplier.get();
1025      return
1026        returnValue == null || returnValue.length <= 0 ? EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY : returnValue.clone();
1027    }
1028  }
1029
1030  /**
1031   * Sets the parameters for this {@link Chain} to <strong>a copy</strong> of the supplied parameters array.
1032   *
1033   * @param parameters the new parameters to copy; may be {@code null} in which case an empty {@link Object} array will
1034   * be used instead
1035   *
1036   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1037   *
1038   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1039   *
1040   * @see #getParameters()
1041   */
1042  @Override // InvocationContext
1043  public final void setParameters(final Object[] parameters) {
1044    if (parameters == null || parameters.length <= 0) {
1045      this.parameters = Chain::emptyObjectArray; // volatile write
1046    } else {
1047      final Object[] clonedParameters = parameters.clone();
1048      this.parameters = () -> clonedParameters; // volatile write
1049    }
1050  }
1051
1052  /**
1053   * Indirectly sets the {@linkplain #getParameters() parameters} of this {@link Chain} by way of the supplied {@link
1054   * Supplier}.
1055   *
1056   * @param parameters a {@link Supplier} of the new parameters; may be {@code null}
1057   *
1058   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1059   *
1060   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1061   *
1062   * @see #setParameters(Object[])
1063   *
1064   * @see #getParameters()
1065   */
1066  public final void setParameters(final Supplier<? extends Object[]> parameters) {
1067    this.parameters = parameters == null ? Chain::emptyObjectArray : parameters; // volatile write
1068  }
1069
1070  /**
1071   * Returns the target of the interception, if any.
1072   *
1073   * @return the target of the interception, or {@code null}
1074   *
1075   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1076   *
1077   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but not necessarily deterministic.
1078   *
1079   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1080   *
1081   * @see InvocationContext#getTarget()
1082   */
1083  @Override // InvocationContext
1084  public final Object getTarget() {
1085    return this.target.get();
1086  }
1087
1088  /**
1089   * Returns a copy of this {@link Chain}.
1090   *
1091   * @return a copy of this {@link Chain}
1092   *
1093   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1094   *
1095   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1096   *
1097   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1098   */
1099  @Override // Cloneable
1100  public final Chain clone() {
1101    return this.copy(0);
1102  }
1103
1104  private final Chain copy(final int index) {
1105    return this.copy(index,
1106                     this::getConstructor,
1107                     this::getMethod,
1108                     this::getTimer,
1109                     this.terminalFunction,
1110                     this.setTarget);
1111  }
1112
1113  private final Chain copy(final int index,
1114                           final Supplier<? extends Constructor<?>> constructorSupplier,
1115                           final Supplier<? extends Method> methodSupplier,
1116                           final Supplier<?> timerSupplier,
1117                           final BiFunction<? super Object, ? super Object[], ?> terminalFunction,
1118                           final boolean setTarget) {
1119    final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions;
1120    // Defensive copying of this map is deliberately not handled by the constructor so we do it here.
1121    final IdentityHashMap<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers =
1122      new IdentityHashMap<>(this.interceptorSuppliers);
1123    final int functionCount = this.interceptorFunctions.size();
1124    if (index <= 0 || functionCount <= 0) {
1125      interceptorFunctions = this.interceptorFunctions;
1126    } else if (index >= functionCount) {
1127      interceptorFunctions = List.of();
1128    } else {
1129      interceptorFunctions = this.interceptorFunctions.subList(index, functionCount);
1130      for (int i = 0; i < index; i++) {
1131        interceptorSuppliers.remove(this.interceptorFunctions.get(i));
1132      }
1133    }
1134    return
1135      new Chain(interceptorFunctions,
1136                false, // sort
1137                false, // copy
1138                interceptorSuppliers,
1139                this.contextData,
1140                this.target,
1141                this.parameters,
1142                constructorSupplier == null ? this::getConstructor : constructorSupplier,
1143                methodSupplier == null ? this::getMethod : methodSupplier,
1144                timerSupplier == null ? this::getTimer : timerSupplier,
1145                terminalFunction,
1146                setTarget,
1147                this.isPrimed());
1148  }
1149
1150  private final Chain copy(final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions,
1151                           final boolean sort) {
1152    return this.copy(interceptorFunctions, sort, new IdentityHashMap<>(this.interceptorSuppliers));
1153  }
1154
1155  private final Chain copy(final List<? extends InterceptorFunction> interceptorFunctions,
1156                           final boolean sort,
1157                           final IdentityHashMap<? extends InterceptorFunction, ? extends Supplier<?>> interceptorSuppliers) {
1158    final Chain returnValue =
1159      new Chain(interceptorFunctions,
1160                sort,
1161                false, // copy
1162                interceptorSuppliers,
1163                this.contextData,
1164                this.target,
1165                this.parameters,
1166                this::getConstructor,
1167                this::getMethod,
1168                this::getTimer,
1169                this.terminalFunction,
1170                this.setTarget,
1171                this.isPrimed());
1172    returnValue.parameters = this.parameters; // volatile read and write
1173    return returnValue;
1174  }
1175
1176  /**
1177   * <em>Primes</em> this {@link Chain} by calling {@link Supplier#get()} on each of its interceptor suppliers, priming
1178   * them for subsequent use.
1179   *
1180   * <p>After an invocation of this method, the {@link #isPrimed()} method will forever afterwards return {@code
1181   * true}.</p>
1182   *
1183   * @return this {@link Chain}
1184   *
1185   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1186   *
1187   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1188   *
1189   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1190   *
1191   * @see #isPrimed()
1192   */
1193  public final Chain prime() {
1194    if (PRIMED.compareAndSet(this, false, true)) { // volatile semantics
1195      final Collection<Supplier<?>> seen = new HashSet<>();
1196      try {
1197        for (final Supplier<?> s : this.interceptorSuppliers.values()) {
1198          if (seen.add(s)) {
1199            s.get();
1200          }
1201        }
1202      } finally {
1203        seen.clear();
1204      }
1205    }
1206    return this;
1207  }
1208
1209  /**
1210   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is primed.
1211   *
1212   * <p>A {@link Chain} is <em>primed</em> after the {@link #prime()} method has been called successfully.</p>
1213   *
1214   * <p>Priming a {@link Chain} initializes its interceptor suppliers.</p>
1215   *
1216   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Chain} is primed
1217   *
1218   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1219   *
1220   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1221   *
1222   * @see #prime()
1223   */
1224  public final boolean isPrimed() {
1225    return this.primed; // volatile read
1226  }
1227
1228  /**
1229   * Calls the {@link #proceed()} method and returns its result.
1230   *
1231   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #proceed()} method
1232   *
1233   * @exception Exception if an error occurs
1234   *
1235   * @see #proceed()
1236   */
1237  @Override
1238  public final Object call() throws Exception {
1239    return this.proceed();
1240  }
1241
1242  /**
1243   * Proceeds to the next interception in the {@link Chain} and returns any result.
1244   *
1245   * @return any result of the interception
1246   *
1247   * @exception Exception if an error occurs
1248   *
1249   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1250   *
1251   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or determinism.
1252   *
1253   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1254   *
1255   * @see InvocationContext#proceed()
1256   */
1257  @Override
1258  public final Object proceed() throws Exception {
1259    final Object returnValue;
1260    if (this.interceptorFunctions.isEmpty()) {
1261      returnValue = this.terminalFunction.apply(this.getTarget(), this.getParameters());
1262      if (this.setTarget) {
1263        this.target.set(returnValue);
1264      }
1265    } else {
1266      final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction = this.interceptorFunctions.get(0);
1267      final Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier = this.interceptorSuppliers.get(interceptorFunction);
1268      final InvocationContext ic = this.copy(1);
1269      assert this.getTarget() == ic.getTarget(); // same AtomicReference
1270      returnValue =
1271        interceptorFunction.intercept(interceptorSupplier == null ? ic.getTarget() : interceptorSupplier.get(), ic);
1272    }
1273    return returnValue;
1274  }
1275
1276
1277  /*
1278   * Static methods.
1279   */
1280
1281
1282  private static final Object[] emptyObjectArray() {
1283    return EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY;
1284  }
1285
1286  private static final <T> T returnNull() {
1287    return null;
1288  }

1290  /**
1291   * Invokes {@link MethodHandles#reflectAs(Class, MethodHandle)} with {@link Constructor Constructor.class} and the
1292   * supplied {@link MethodHandle} as arguments, and returns the result.
1293   *
1294   * @param mh the {@link MethodHandle} representing a constructor; must not be {@code null}
1295   *
1296   * @return a {@link Constructor} representing the supplied {@link MethodHandle}
1297   *
1298   * @exception ClassCastException if {@code mh} does not represent a constructor
1299   *
1300   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code mh} is not a direct method handle
1301   *
1302   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code mh} is {@code null}
1303   *
1304   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1305   *
1306   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1307   *
1308   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1309   */
1310  public static final Constructor<?> constructor(final MethodHandle mh) {
1311    return MethodHandles.reflectAs(Constructor.class, mh);
1312  }
1313
1314  /**
1315   * Invokes {@link MethodHandles#reflectAs(Class, MethodHandle)} with {@link Method Method.class} and the supplied
1316   * {@link MethodHandle} as arguments, and returns the result.
1317   *
1318   * @param mh the {@link MethodHandle} representing a method; must not be {@code null}
1319   *
1320   * @return a {@link Method} representing the supplied {@link MethodHandle}
1321   *
1322   * @exception ClassCastException if {@code mh} does not represent a method
1323   *
1324   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code mh} is not a direct method handle
1325   *
1326   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code mh} is {@code null}
1327   *
1328   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1329   *
1330   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1331   *
1332   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1333   */
1334  public static final Method method(final MethodHandle mh) {
1335    return MethodHandles.reflectAs(Method.class, mh);
1336  }
1337
1338  /**
1339   * Returns an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method designated by the supplied arguments.
1340   *
1341   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1342   *
1343   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the method; must not be {@code null}
1344   *
1345   * @param methodName the name of the method; must not be {@code null}
1346   *
1347   * @return an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method designated by the supplied arguments
1348   *
1349   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1350   *
1351   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs while looking up the relevant method
1352   *
1353   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1354   *
1355   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1356   *
1357   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1358   */
1359  public static final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup,
1360                                                              final Class<?> targetClass,
1361                                                              final String methodName) {
1362    try {
1363      return
1364        interceptorFunction(lookup,
1365                            lookup.findVirtual(targetClass,
1366                                               methodName,
1367                                               INTERCEPTORFUNCTION_METHOD_TYPE));
1368    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1369      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1370    }
1371  }
1372
1373  /**
1374   * Returns an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method designated by the supplied arguments.
1375   *
1376   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1377   *
1378   * @param method a {@link Method}; must not be {@code null}
1379   *
1380   * @return an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method designated by the supplied arguments
1381   *
1382   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1383   *
1384   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs while {@linkplain Lookup#unreflect(Method) unreflecting} the
1385   * relevant method
1386   *
1387   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1388   *
1389   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1390   *
1391   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1392   */
1393  public static final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final Method method) {
1394    try {
1395      return interceptorFunction(lookup, lookup.unreflect(method));
1396    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
1397      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1398    }
1399  }
1400
1401  /**
1402   * Returns an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method designated by the supplied arguments.
1403   *
1404   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1405   *
1406   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be null}
1407   *
1408   * @return an {@link InterceptorFunction} representing the method designated by the supplied arguments
1409   *
1410   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1411   *
1412   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs while looking up the relevant method
1413   *
1414   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1415   *
1416   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1417   *
1418   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1419   */
1420  public static final InterceptorFunction interceptorFunction(final Lookup lookup, final MethodHandle mh) {
1421    final MethodType methodType = mh.type();
1422    final String methodName;
1423    final MethodType factoryType;
1424    final MethodType signature;
1425    if (void.class.equals(methodType.returnType())) {
1426      methodName = "execute";
1427      factoryType = INTERCEPTORPROCEDURE_FACTORY_TYPE;
1428      signature = INTERCEPTORPROCEDURE_EXECUTE_SIGNATURE;
1429    } else {
1430      methodName = "intercept";
1431      factoryType = INTERCEPTORFUNCTION_FACTORY_TYPE;
1432      signature = INTERCEPTORFUNCTION_INTERCEPT_SIGNATURE;
1433    }
1434    try {
1435      final MethodHandle factory =
1436        LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1437                                      methodName,
1438                                      factoryType,
1439                                      signature,
1440                                      mh, // better conform to signature
1441                                      methodType) // signature enforced dynamically at runtime
1442        .getTarget();
1443      return
1444        factoryType.returnType() == InterceptorFunction.class ?
1445        (InterceptorFunction)factory.invokeExact() :
1446        (InterceptorProcedure)factory.invokeExact();
1447    } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1448      throw e;
1449    } catch (final Exception e) {
1450      if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1451        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1452      }
1453      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1454    } catch (final Throwable e) {
1455      throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1456    }
1457  }
1458
1459  /**
1460   * Returns a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)}
1461   * method, built from the supplied arguments.
1462   *
1463   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1464   *
1465   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the desired method; must not be {@code null}
1466   *
1467   * @param methodName the name of the method to lookup; must not be {@code null}
1468   *
1469   * @param methodType a {@link MethodType} representing the desired method's signature and return type; must not be
1470   * {@code null}
1471   *
1472   * @return a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)}
1473   * method, built from the supplied arguments
1474   *
1475   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1476   *
1477   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs
1478   *
1479   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1480   *
1481   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1482   *
1483   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1484   *
1485   * @see #terminalFunction(Lookup, MethodHandle)
1486   *
1487   * @see Lookup#findVirtual(Class, String, MethodType)
1488   */
1489  public static final BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> terminalFunction(final Lookup lookup,
1490                                                                            final Class<?> targetClass,
1491                                                                            final String methodName,
1492                                                                            final MethodType methodType) {
1493    try {
1494      return
1495        terminalFunction(lookup,
1496                         lookup.findVirtual(targetClass,
1497                                            methodName,
1498                                            methodType));
1499    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1500      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1501    }
1502  }
1503
1504  /**
1505   * Returns a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)}
1506   * method, built from the supplied arguments.
1507   *
1508   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} {@linkplain Lookup#privateLookupIn(Class, Lookup) in which to create a private
1509   * <code>Lookup</code>}; must not be {@code null}
1510   *
1511   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code null}
1512   *
1513   * @return a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)}
1514   * method, built from the supplied arguments
1515   *
1516   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1517   *
1518   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs
1519   *
1520   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1521   *
1522   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1523   *
1524   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1525   *
1526   * @see #terminalFunction(Lookup, MethodHandle)
1527   */
1528  public static final BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> terminalFunction(final Class<?> targetClass, MethodHandle mh) {
1529    try {
1530      return terminalFunction(MethodHandles.privateLookupIn(targetClass, MethodHandles.lookup()), mh);
1531    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
1532      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1533    }
1534  }
1535
1536  /**
1537   * Returns a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)}
1538   * method, built from the supplied arguments.
1539   *
1540   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1541   *
1542   * @param mh a {@link MethodHandle}; must not be {@code null}
1543   *
1544   * @return a {@link BiFunction} suitable for supplying to the {@link #withTerminalFunction(BiFunction, Supplier)}
1545   * method, built from the supplied arguments
1546   *
1547   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1548   *
1549   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs
1550   *
1551   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1552   *
1553   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1554   *
1555   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1556   */
1557  public static final BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> terminalFunction(final Lookup lookup, MethodHandle mh) {
1558    final MethodType methodType = mh.type();
1559    final int parameterCount = methodType.parameterCount();
1560    BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object> returnValue = null;
1561    if (parameterCount <= 0) {
1562      throw new IllegalArgumentException("mh.methodType().parameterCount() <= 0: " + mh);
1563    } else if (parameterCount == 1) {
1564      // The sole parameter is assumed to be the receiver type, so the virtual method the handle represents has no
1565      // parameters.
1566      if (void.class.equals(methodType.returnType())) {
1567        // The virtual method the handle represents has no parameters and returns nothing, so is like a Runnable.  We
1568        // have to use Consumer::accept because of the sole receiver parameter.
1569        try {
1570          final Consumer<? super Object> consumer =
1571            (Consumer<? super Object>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1572                                                                    "accept",
1573                                                                    CONSUMER_FACTORY_TYPE,
1574                                                                    CONSUMER_ACCEPT_SIGNATURE,
1575                                                                    mh,
1576                                                                    methodType)
1577            .getTarget()
1578            .invokeExact();
1579          returnValue = (t, x) -> {
1580            consumer.accept(t);
1581            return null;
1582          };
1583        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1584          throw e;
1585        } catch (final Exception e) {
1586          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1587            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1588          }
1589          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1590        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1591          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1592        }
1593      } else {
1594        // The virtual method the handle represents has no parameters and returns something, so is like a Supplier<?>.
1595        // We have to use Function::<? super Object, ?>apply because of the receiver parameter.
1596        try {
1597          final Function<? super Object, ?> function =
1598            (Function<? super Object, ?>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1599                                                                       "apply",
1600                                                                       FUNCTION_FACTORY_TYPE,
1601                                                                       FUNCTION_APPLY_SIGNATURE,
1602                                                                       mh,
1603                                                                       methodType)
1604            .getTarget()
1605            .invokeExact();
1606          returnValue = (t, x) -> function.apply(t);
1607        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1608          throw e;
1609        } catch (final Exception e) {
1610          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1611            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1612          }
1613          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1614        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1615          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1616        }
1617      }
1618    } else if (parameterCount == 2 && Object[].class.equals(methodType.parameterType(1))) {
1619      // The virtual method the handle represents has one parameter of type Object[].class.  The first of the two
1620      // parameters is the receiver type.
1621      if (void.class.equals(methodType.returnType())) {
1622        // The virtual method the handle represents takes one parameter of type Object[].class and returns nothing, so
1623        // is like a Consumer<? super Object[]>.  We have to use BiConsumer::<? super Object, ? super Object[]>accept
1624        // because of the receiver parameter.
1625        try {
1626          final BiConsumer<? super Object, ? super Object[]> biConsumer =
1627            (BiConsumer<? super Object, ? super Object[]>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1628                                                                                        "accept",
1629                                                                                        BICONSUMER_FACTORY_TYPE, // returns BiConsumer and captures no variables
1630                                                                                        BICONSUMER_ACCEPT_SIGNATURE,
1631                                                                                        mh, // better conform to signature
1632                                                                                        methodType) // signature enforced dynamically at runtime (same as compiled/erased in this case)
1633            .getTarget()
1634            .invokeExact();
1635          returnValue = (t, p) -> {
1636            biConsumer.accept(t, p);
1637            return null;
1638          };
1639        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1640          throw e;
1641        } catch (final Exception e) {
1642          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1643            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1644          }
1645          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1646        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1647          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1648        }
1649      } else {
1650        // The virtual method the handle represents takes one parameter of type Object[].class and returns something, so
1651        // is like a Function<? super Object[], ?>.  We have to use BiFunction::<? super Object, ? super Object[],
1652        // ?>apply because of the receiver parameter.
1653        try {
1654          returnValue =
1655            (BiFunction<Object, Object[], Object>)LambdaMetafactory.metafactory(lookup,
1656                                                                                "apply",
1657                                                                                BIFUNCTION_FACTORY_TYPE, // returns BiFunction and captures no variables
1658                                                                                BIFUNCTION_APPLY_SIGNATURE, // compiled/erased signature of BiFunction::apply
1659                                                                                mh, // better conform to signature
1660                                                                                methodType) // signature enforced dynamically at runtime
1661            .getTarget()
1662            .invokeExact();
1663        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1664          throw e;
1665        } catch (final Exception e) {
1666          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1667            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1668          }
1669          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1670        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1671          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1672        }
1673      }
1674    } else {
1675      final MethodHandle spreader = mh.asSpreader(Object[].class, parameterCount - 1);
1676      returnValue = (t, p) -> {
1677        try {
1678          return spreader.invoke(t, p);
1679        } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
1680          throw e;
1681        } catch (final Exception e) {
1682          if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
1683            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1684          }
1685          throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1686        } catch (final Throwable e) {
1687          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
1688        }
1689      };
1690    }
1691    return returnValue;
1692  }
1693
1694  /**
1695   * Returns a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1696   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.
1697   *
1698   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1699   *
1700   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the constructor; must not be {@code null}
1701   *
1702   * @param parameters the constructor's parameters; must not be {@code null}
1703   *
1704   * @return a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1705   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments
1706   *
1707   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1708   *
1709   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs looking up the constructor
1710   *
1711   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1712   *
1713   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1714   *
1715   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1716   *
1717   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, Class, MethodType)
1718   *
1719   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
1720   */
1721  public static final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup,
1722                                                                     final Class<?> targetClass,
1723                                                                     final List<? extends Class<?>> parameters) {
1724    return
1725      terminalConstructor(lookup,
1726                          targetClass,
1727                          MethodType.methodType(void.class,
1728                                                parameters == null || parameters.isEmpty() ? List.of() : List.copyOf(parameters)));
1729  }

1731  /**
1732   * Returns a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1733   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.
1734   *
1735   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1736   *
1737   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the constructor; must not be {@code null}
1738   *
1739   * @param methodTypeWithVoidReturnType a {@link MethodType} describing the constructor's parameters; must not be
1740   * {@code null}
1741   *
1742   * @return a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1743   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments
1744   *
1745   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1746   *
1747   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs looking up the constructor
1748   *
1749   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1750   *
1751   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1752   *
1753   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1754   *
1755   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, Constructor)
1756   *
1757   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
1758   *
1759   * @see Lookup#findConstructor(Class, MethodType)
1760   */
1761  public static final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup,
1762                                                                     final Class<?> targetClass,
1763                                                                     final MethodType methodTypeWithVoidReturnType) {
1764    try {
1765      return terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.findConstructor(targetClass, methodTypeWithVoidReturnType));
1766    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1767      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1768    }
1769  }

1771  /**
1772   * Returns a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1773   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.
1774   *
1775   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1776   *
1777   * @param targetClass the {@link Class} hosting the method; must not be {@code null}
1778   *
1779   * @param factoryMethodName the name of a virtual method to look up that will create an instance of the supplied
1780   * {@code methodType}'s {@linkplain MethodType#returnType() return type}; must not be {@code null}
1781   *
1782   * @param methodType a {@link MethodType} describing the method; must not be {@code null}
1783   *
1784   * @return a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1785   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments
1786   *
1787   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1788   *
1789   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs looking up the method
1790   *
1791   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1792   *
1793   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1794   *
1795   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1796   *
1797   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
1798   *
1799   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, Method)
1800   *
1801   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
1802   *
1803   * @see Lookup#findVirtual(Class, String, MethodType)
1804   */
1805  public static final Function<Object[], Object> terminalConstructor(final Lookup lookup,
1806                                                                     final Class<?> targetClass,
1807                                                                     final String factoryMethodName,
1808                                                                     final MethodType methodType) {
1809    try {
1810      return terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.findVirtual(targetClass, factoryMethodName, methodType));
1811    } catch (final IllegalAccessException | NoSuchMethodException e) {
1812      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);
1813    }
1814  }

1816  /**

1818   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.

1824   *

1826   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments
1827   *

1829   *
1830   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs looking up the constructor
1831   *

1837   *

1839   *
1840   * @see #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
1841   */

1843    try {
1844      return terminalConstructor(lookup, lookup.unreflectConstructor(constructor));
1845    } catch (final IllegalAccessException e) {
1846      throw new InterceptorException(e.getMessage(), e);

1850  /**
1851   * Returns a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1852   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments.
1853   *
1854   * @param lookup a {@link Lookup}; must not be {@code null}
1855   *
1856   * @param method a factory {@link Method} to {@linkplain Lookup#unreflect(Method) unreflect}; must not be {@code null}
1857   *
1858   * @return a {@link Function} suitable for use as a {@linkplain #withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier) terminal
1859   * constructor} built from the supplied arguments
1860   *
1861   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
1862   *
1863   * @exception InterceptorException if an error occurs looking up the constructor
1864   *
1865   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1866   *
1867   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1868   *
1869   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1870   *
1871   * @see #terminalConstructor(Lookup, MethodHandle)
